headlines.marketGrowth: Computer market sees exceptional growth in current quarter
headlines.priceWar: Price war between manufacturers leads to cheaper home computers
headlines.newSegments: New target groups discover computers as versatile tools
headlines.retailBoom: Retailers report significantly increased demand for computer accessories
headlines.softwareProfit: Software developers profit enormously from expanding computer market
headlines.techBreakthrough: Breakthrough in processor technology promises significantly faster computers
headlines.graphicsRevolution: Revolutionary graphics chips to elevate gaming experience to entirely new level
headlines.memoryAdvance: Memory technology makes computers even more attractive for businesses
headlines.audioQuality: Audio chips reach quality level of professional music studios
headlines.storageDouble: New hard drive technology doubles storage capacity at same cost
headlines.competitorExpansion: Established computer manufacturers announce aggressive expansion plans
headlines.internationalPush: International corporations increasingly push into German computer market
headlines.mergerRumors: Merger of two computer manufacturers could fundamentally change market landscape
headlines.newEntrant: New market entrant promises revolutionary computers at low prices
headlines.tradeAgreements: International trade agreements promote global technology exchange
headlines.educationReform: Education reforms provide for increased computer use in schools
headlines.economicBoom: Economic upswing significantly strengthens demand for office automation
headlines.culturalShift: Cultural change makes computers symbol of modern lifestyle
headlines.marketStability: Computer industry continues to show stable growth despite market challenges

content.marketGrowth: Market researchers report an impressive increase in sales figures that exceeds all expectations and makes the industry optimistic.
content.priceWar: Intensifying competition forces computer manufacturers to make drastic price cuts, which benefits consumers but reduces profit margins.
content.newSegments: While computers were primarily used by technology enthusiasts, they are now conquering offices and living rooms of ordinary families.
content.retailBoom: Specialty stores report a surprising boom in printers, diskettes and monitors, reflecting the strong proliferation of home computers.
content.softwareProfit: The growing number of computer owners brings developers dream revenues and drives innovation in all application areas.
content.techBreakthrough: Engineers have developed new manufacturing processes that enable production of processors with higher clock speeds and better energy efficiency.
content.graphicsRevolution: The latest generation of graphics processors promises unprecedented display quality and will take gaming computers to new dimensions.
content.memoryAdvance: New RAM modules with greater capacity and lower prices enable companies to equip more powerful workstations cost-effectively.
content.audioQuality: Advances in digital signal processing produce sound quality that delights even demanding musicians and audiophiles.
content.storageDouble: Revolutionary developments in magnetic data storage promise computers with unprecedented storage capacities for private users and professionals.
content.competitorExpansion: Industry giants invest billions in new production capacities and research to defend their market leadership against emerging competitors.
content.internationalPush: American and Japanese technology companies intensify their efforts to conquer European markets and pressure local manufacturers.
content.mergerRumors: Speculation about an impending takeover causes unrest in the industry and could shift power dynamics in the computer sector.
content.newEntrant: A previously unknown company announces plans to offer computers using innovative production methods that will blow away previous price-performance ratios.
content.tradeAgreements: New diplomatic agreements facilitate import and export of computer components, giving manufacturers better access to worldwide markets.
content.educationReform: Education ministers of various countries plan massive investments in school computers to familiarize students with modern technology early on.
content.economicBoom: The improved economic situation encourages companies to invest in computer technology to optimize workflows and gain competitive advantages.
content.culturalShift: Computers are evolving from niche tools to status symbols of upwardly mobile social classes and shape the self-image of tech-savvy citizens.
content.marketStability: Experts confirm the continuing positive development of the computer market, which proves surprisingly resilient to economic fluctuations.

title: COMPUTER GAZETTE
tagline: The leading newspaper for computer technology and electronics
